PARAGRAPH.STRING: (official name: San Francisco de Quito) is the capital city of Ecuador in northwestern South America.
is located in northern Ecuador (see map) in the Guayllabamba river basin on the eastern slopes of the Pichincha ( 15,728 ft; 4,794 m), an active stratovolcano in the Andes mountains.
elevation is 9,300 ft (2,850 m) above sea level (measured at the Plaza de la Independencia), making
the second highest capital city in the world.
population according to the most recent census (2001) was 1,399,378. In 2005, however, the estimated population was 1,865,541 (canton). The area of

position as the second highest (elevation) capital in the world, but La Paz, Bolivia, which is where the Bolivian government functions, is the governmental capital of Bolivia. Sucre is the legal capital of Bolivia.
is located about 15 miles (25 km) south of the equator. A monument marking the equator is known locally as la mitad del mundo (the middle of the world).
altitude and location, the climate in
is mild to cool, fairly constant all year round, with a high temperature typically around 67 degrees Fahrenheit (20°C) on any given day, and a low around 49 degrees Fahrenheit (10°C) at night.
experiences only two seasons: summer (the dry season) and winter (the rainy season).
is the second most populous city in Ecuador after Guayaquil.
